trans-unit.source: Represents a ribbon toolbar that is always visible in the window frame to provide access to common commands.

You add a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar> to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> control by specifying it as the content of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.QuickAccessToolBar%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property using XAML [Property Element Syntax](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/xaml-syntax-in-detail.md).
The following list shows the typical placement of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar> in the hierarchy of ribbon elements.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.QuickAccessToolBar%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonRadioButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonToggleButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonCheckBox>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTextBox>
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonComboBox>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonSplitButton>
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar"></xref> class.
Adds a handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.Clone"></xref> routed event.
The element to add the event to.
The event handler to be added.
Unloads the container for the specified item.
This method undoes the effects of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.PrepareContainerForItemOverride%2A> method.
The element that is used to display the item.
The item to display from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.Clone"></xref> routed event.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton"></xref> that is used to show the Quick Access Toolbar customization menu.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A button that is used to show the Quick Access Toolbar customization menu.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.CustomizeMenuButton"></xref> dependency property.
Returns a new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControl"></xref> object.

A new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControl"></xref> container object that is used to display an item from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.IsOverflowItem"></xref> attached property for an object.
The object from which the property value is read.
The objectâ€™s <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.IsOverflowItem"></xref> property value.
The specified element is `null`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the Quick Access Toolbar has items hidden in the overflow menu.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the Quick Access Toolbar has items hidden in the overflow menu; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.HasOverflowItems"></xref> dependency property.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own container.
The item to test.
`true` if the item is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControl"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.IsOverflowItem"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the Quick Access Toolbar overflow menu is open.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
`true` if the Quick Access Toolbar overflow menu is open; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.IsOverflowOpen"></xref> dependency property.
Called when the KeyTip or accelerator key is pressed.
Contains data about the activation.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar"></xref> when a new template is applied.
This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as a rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> method.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.RibbonQuickAccessToolBarAutomationPeer"></xref> object for this control.
A new automation peer object for this control.
Invoked when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> property changes.
Information about the change.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event.
The event data.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.KeyTipService.PreviewKeyTipAccessed"></xref> routed event.
The event data.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
The element that is used to display the item.
The item to display from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
Removes the handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.Clone"></xref> routed event.
The element to remove the event from.
The event handler to be removed.
Gets a reference to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> that this control belongs to.
This property is set on the parent <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> control and is inherited by the child controls.
It is used to access visual style brushes defined on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> class.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A reference to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> that this control belongs to.
The registered default is `null`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonQuickAccessToolBar.Ribbon"></xref> dependency property.
